intro: Moutabea pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific moutabea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Moutabea pacifica is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils.
